{{Useful Function}}

This function gets an '''online''' player from their [[/serial.md|serial]].
==Syntax==
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">player getPlayerFromSerial ( string serial )</syntaxhighlight>

===Required Arguments===
* '''serial''': A string determining the serial of player you want to get.

===Returns===
Returns a [[/player.md|player]] element if the specified [[/serial.md|serial]] is owned by an existent player on the server, ''false'' otherwise.

==Code==
<section name="Server" class="server" show="true"><syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
function getPlayerFromSerial ( serial )
    assert ( type ( serial ) == "string" and #serial == 32, "getPlayerFromSerial - invalid serial" )
    for index, player in ipairs ( getElementsByType ( "player" ) ) do
        if ( getPlayerSerial ( player ) == serial ) then
            return player
        end
    end
    return false
end
</syntaxhighlight></section>

==Example==
This example gets a player name from random serial and outputs it in chatbox.
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
outputChatBox( getPlayerName ( getPlayerFromSerial( "AE9EP68QXKHW55LQIAL9C77Q9VJHA00M" ) ) )
</syntaxhighlight>

Author: Tete

Hint: This function can be useful for building up a serial-based system.
